skill.name: typescript-jsdoc
skill.description: Write effective JSDoc comments for TypeScript code. Provides guidance on documentation format, strategic placement, best practices, and when to document versus when to keep code self-documenting. Helps maintain code clarity and IDE support.
skill.summary: Write effective JSDoc comments for TypeScript code. Provides guidance on documentation format, strat...
skill.author: AdamManuel-dev

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance files. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands. This is a reference guide for JSDoc best practices.

content.value_statement: TypeScript code often lacks proper documentation. This skill provides comprehensive guidance on writing effective JSDoc comments that enhance code maintainability, improve IDE support, and help developers understand complex APIs quickly.
actual_capabilities: Guide on JSDoc format and essential tags like @param, @returns, @throws
Explain when to document versus when code is self-documenting
Provide patterns for documenting complex APIs and generic functions
Show anti-patterns to avoid redundant or outdated documentation
Demonstrate documentation structure for classes and React components
Teach strategic documentation levels from essential to minimal
limitations: Does not generate JSDoc comments automatically
Does not validate existing documentation against best practices
Does not integrate with build tools or documentation generators
Focus is on TypeScript specifically, not other documentation formats

use_cases.title: Improve Code Documentation
use_cases.description: Learn to write clear, concise JSDoc that enhances maintainability and provides better IDE auto-complete support.

use_cases.title: Document Public APIs
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive documentation for exported functions, classes, and interfaces that serves library users effectively.

use_cases.title: Review Documentation Quality
use_cases.description: Identify documentation anti-patterns and ensure team code follows consistent documentation standards.

prompt_templates.title: Basic JSDoc Help
prompt_templates.scenario: Need guidance on documenting a function
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I write JSDoc for a TypeScript function that takes parameters and returns a value?

prompt_templates.title: Document Complex Types
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the proper way to document nested object parameters and generic type parameters in JSDoc?

prompt_templates.title: React Component Docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to document a React component with TypeScript props using JSDoc.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: When should I use essential, clarifying, or minimal documentation levels for my TypeScript code?

output_examples.input: How do I document a TypeScript function that calculates a total price with tax?
output: Use @param for each parameter with a hyphen and description
Use @returns to describe what the function returns
Focus on the 'why' and 'how' rather than repeating types
Add @example to show usage when helpful
Keep it concise for self-documenting code

best_practices: Document the 'why' and 'how' rather than repeating type information that TypeScript already provides
Use strategic documentation levels: essential for public APIs, clarifying for complex behavior, minimal for self-documenting code
Update documentation when behavior, side effects, or error conditions change to prevent outdated docs
anti_patterns: Repeating type information in @param descriptions when TypeScript already declares types
Documenting implementation details that might change instead of the stable contract
Over-documenting obvious code where function names and signatures are self-explanatory

faq.question: Does this skill work with plain JavaScript or only TypeScript?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on TypeScript specifically. For plain JavaScript, JSDoc serves both documentation and type checking purposes.

faq.question: What are the most important JSDoc tags to learn first?
faq.answer: Start with @param, @returns, and @example. Add @throws, @deprecated, and @see as your documentation needs grow.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with documentation tools like TypeDoc?
faq.answer: Yes, following JSDoc best practices produces better output from documentation generators like TypeDoc.

faq.question: Is my documentation data stored or transmitted anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance only and does not access, store, or transmit any documentation data.

faq.question: Why is my IDE not showing JSDoc suggestions?
faq.answer: Ensure your comments use the correct /** */ format, tags start with @, and parameters are named correctly to match the function signature.

faq.question: How is this different from other documentation tools?
faq.answer: This skill teaches principles and patterns for writing better documentation rather than generating or validating docs automatically.
